channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-10219] ipc.Client.setupIOstreams() needs to check for ClientCache.stopClient requested shutdowns
item.description:
When ClientCache.stopClient() is called to stop the IPC client, if the client
is blocked spinning due to a connectivity problem, it does not exit until the policy has timed out -so the stopClient() operation can hang for an extended period of time.

This can surface in the shutdown hook of FileSystem.cache.closeAll()

Also, Client.stop() is for used in NN switch from Standby to Active, and can therefore have very bad consequences and cause downtime.
item.summary: ipc.Client.setupIOstreams() needs to check for ClientCache.stopClient requested shutdowns

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This is the root cause of HDFS-5755.
I manually tested this patch in a non-ha env. ^C now kills the main thread that is stuck in making connection.

-1 overall

uname Linux asf901.gq1.ygridcore.net 3.13.0-36-lowlatency #63-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT Wed Sep 3 21:56:12 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Console output https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/7781/console

This message was automatically generated.
I think your IDE went over-zealous in the indentation there...
+ you may need a check that you aren't trying to interrupt yourself in interruptConnectingThread()

I don't know why I thought a try block was necessary in getConnection(). That was useless since setupIOstreams() doesn't even throw.

Since connectingThread is only set inside the synchronized method, setupIOstreams(), and unset in the corresponding finally block, the caller thread won't be interrupting itself.

Tested the new patch manually against a blackhole namenode. ^C stops the client immediately.

Let's see what the new precommit says.

the findbugs seems to be spurious at this point?

Might be better to use an AtomicReference< Thread > and get/set that: one field to manage, less convoluted, and less likely to confuse findbugs

regarding the main IPC patch: someone who knows their way round that code is going to have to review it. I'm not that person, I'm afraid
Thanks for the feedback, changed to AtomicReference.

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/ipc/TestIPC.java

Hi stevel@apache.org and kihwal,

Thanks for reporting the issue and working on,

If you have, would you please post some jstack frames that shows the problem for future reference?
